name: Narita Tobu Hotel Air Port

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I got to Narita from Incheon and my hotel for the week in Tokyo could not get me in a day earlier. I went to the Hotel Support Desk at the airport and the gals there procured this room for me for the night. At 7300 yen with breakfast included you can't really complain. Their free shuttle picked me up and then returned me to the airport the next day to catch the train to Tokyo. The room was nice and clean with no smell of smoke.
reviews.title: Okay and cheap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Side note- If you are Priority Club member they give you half of the gym which is nice even though it needs a new treadmill badly. The treadmill just can't handle a 190lb guy running on it. They have a pool and a dry sauna too which are both pretty decent.
reviews.title: This is not a good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was good and the staff were great. Honestly I think they are doing the best they can with an old hotel. If they closed it to renovate to some people's modern standards then it wouldn't be a bargain anymore. Plus it has free Internet but bring a long Cat5 cable if you want to sit on your bed and work.
reviews.title: Great location, price and rooms and good food!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also the desk there at Narita airport needs serious kudos. Not only are the gals EXTREMELY patient with us foreigners but they even have rates lower than I found anywhere else. If it wasn't for corporate policy I think I would just travel to Japan and go straight to this desk for cheap hotels in the greater Tokyo metro area.
reviews.title: Convenient and Comfortable Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel on two occasions in December.
reviews.title: Convenient airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay a night here in order to easily catch our flight home the next morning. As you probably know, the Narita airport is an hour away from Tokyo, so sometimes it's better to stay near the airport the night before in order to fly out of the country the next morning.
reviews.title: Great price and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must say I was impressed considering the cheap price we got it for. The staff were helpful, the room was fine and they had a shuttle to the airport.
reviews.title: Nice hotel: how to beat the way too expensive restaurant prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: For some reason I couldn't get the air conditioner working, though we didn't really need it.
reviews.title: Shuttle bus infrequent. No a/c sometimes!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aside from that I had no complaints. I would definitely recommend staying here if you need a cheap, comfortable hotel for the night.
reviews.title: Dirty and Dated but convenient for stopovers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel is very conveniently located on minutes from Narita International Airport. I booked in through the Holiday Inn website and made sure I was a priority club member (their frequent visitor program) before booking the hotel. This gets you two coupons when you check in that you can use for a discount in the restaurants, free late check out, and a couple more things.
reviews.title: Ideal Airport Overnighter
Great transit hotel
reviews.text: Great hotel that is very close to the airport. Staff were very friendly and our room was modern and very clean. They have a free shuttle service to and from the airport. Would recommend this hotel if you're looking for something that is reasonably priced and close to Narita airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Holiday Inn near Narita Airport four years ago on our way from Europe to Australia and were quite satisfied. However, we saw that there were many similar hotels in the vicinity and, when considering where we should stay on the way to the UK from Australia on this trip, I consulted the Tripadvisor reviews. Since the Holiday Inn was rated first among the hotels reviewed, I booked through the Holiday Inn website and obtained a very cheap 14-day advance booking rate for the room and breakfast for three nights for my wife and myself. The package became even cheaper as tthe Australian dollar appreciated against the yen between the time I made the booking and the time my credit card was debited (the first night was debited only on arrival and the other two nights on checking out). As members of the Priority Club we were also given vouchers which allowed a 10% discount on restaurant meals in the hotel. Thus the whole package provided excellent value. The staff spoke sufficient English to meet our needs and were most helpful.
reviews.title: Good value at Narita, Tokyo's international airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room, in the West wing, was comfortably spacious and adequately, though not lavishly, equipped. I suspect that the rooms in the East wing may be smaller, judging from the diagram on the envelope in which the vouchers were contained. There were some signs of wear on the walls, which are perhaps due for re-papering, but the two beds were firm and clean. The shower was not the best, since it was over the bath and difficult to direct away from the wall, but it served its purpose.
reviews.title: yuck!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: The hotel provides a free shuttle regularly throughout most of the day and evening to and from the airport terminals, which are only minutes away. It also provides a free shuttle at approximately hourly intervals for most of the day to and from the town of Narita. If that is not convenient, two buses circulate round all the hotels and the town in opposite directions for a very reasonable fare. The town in well worth visiting for its main temple and beautiful gardens. The town and airport are each served by two train lines. An easy train ride takes one to several interesting places nearby. This makes it unnecessary to take the long ride into Tokyo.
reviews.title: Repeat stay, Remains excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Totally unimpressed with the Holiday Inn. It looked like there were two wings and we ended up in the older wing. Our room didn't appear particularly clean, the bed wasn't comfortable, and even though we were in a non-smoking room (on a non-smoking floor), we could smell cigarette smoke in our room. The air conditioning vent hadn't been cleaned in so long that there was a black stain on the ceiling from the dirty air being blown into the room. It was cheap, but I wouldn't stay there again.
reviews.title: Good airport overnite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: There are lots of airport hotels near Narita airport but Holiday inn is the closest from the Narita Airport.
reviews.title: Closest hotel from the airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the hotels near the airports are relatively old and bit expensive. Since I was alone, I didn't want to stay in a very cheap hotels either so I decided to stay here.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a transit stop in Narita

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010
reviews.text: They have a swimming pool, gym and little store which you can buy snacks, drinks, souvenires. So, I could survive without going to the expensive restaurant in the hotel.
reviews.title: great hotel for an early flight the nxt morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Single room is very small in Japan so I stayed Twin room. ( Single use, East Wing, Standard) They had a Special room plan called "Airport Plan". Since I had to leave very early in the morning, I chose without Breakfast but it was OK, most of the Japanese hotels has a tea pot so that I could make my tea in the room.
reviews.title: Covers the need.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Also, I was a member of the Priority Club, so they gave me a coupon, the options are free bottle of water or free spa or discount in a hotel restaurant.
reviews.title: Good hotel near Narita airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's difficult to review airport hotels as they are bound to lack a certain charm. On the plus side, the hotel is very close to the airport, is cheap and there is a good shuttle service. On the negative side, the hotel is very 1970s dated, the room had no air con, the restaurant is far too expensive and there hotel feels very impersonal. But my major gripe was the lack of air con. Still, it was for one night and that's all.
reviews.title: A fair standard of airport hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Tobu Narita the night before flying to London in June 2010.
reviews.title: Very big rooms & handy free buses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were really happy with our room which was very spacious and had great views across the one of the runways and airport buildings.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quiet and had free high speed internet (using cable the hotel provided) which is always appreciated and handy. The Yukata style bathrobes were a nice touch. Also, it was an extremely hot day but the temperature in the room was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Good for early morning flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best features of this hotel is the free bus services they provide not only between the hotel and airport terminals but also to Narita town and also to a large shopping mall around 20 mins away. The mall is quite big and has many shops, restaurants (inc Hard Rock cafe) and a large supermarket. To find out the bus timetable simply ask at the check in desk and they will give you a card with all of the bus times on it. This is a fantastic service especially given that it is free.
reviews.title: Convenient for airport departure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: First hotel I had stayed at in Japan, and we didn't have any problems. Since it's been a while since I was actually there, I forget what part of the building or which floor we were in, but everything was certainly clean enough, and the room was as large if not larger than many of the cheaper hotels I end up staying at in America.
reviews.title: Pretty good

likes.liked: — Shuttle service, decent rooms, free internet
likes.disliked: — No easily accessible places for food in the area around the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were helpful and usually available, and spoke english.
reviews.title: Can't beat the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chosing a hotel for this part of the trip took a while, and it came down to being convenient and not so much the cost.
reviews.title: Some rooms are shoddy looking

likes.disliked: — The walls of the room were beat up and the hallway carpet looked very dirty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best and most useful services was the shuttle bus to/from the airport, and to/from the mall, and to/from th actual town of Narita. I think many people overlook what can be seen in this area. The buses are important though because the area around the hotel is almost exclusively car parking companies, and occasionally a vending machine. The hotel does have a restaurant or two but we didn't utilize it, luckily there is a pretty good convenience/souvenir store in the hotel with some decent food (breads, ramen and other instant meals) and a vending area with both food and drink vending machines.
reviews.title: Ideal for close-to-airport stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the buses come fairly regularly, and they gave us a card with the bus schedule when we checked in. I believe the day after arriving we went to the mall, which is fairly large and has a pretty decent food court (pepper lunch!), music stores, arcade, even a Sports Authority.
reviews.title: Excellent mid-priced stay near Narita

likes.liked: — Good value for money, shuttle service to airport and buffet.
likes.disliked: — Housekeeping missed a potentially harmful piece of rubbish in my room.

reviews.title: The Perfect Transit Hotel
reviews.text: I actually stayed here twice; once in November of last year and then a second time last month. I chose to stay a second time because I loved it so much the first time I stayed. Like the title says, this is the perfect transit hotel. I think it is also the cheapest hotel in the area. I guess that's why i like it so much; it's pretty affordable and it has all the features of the more expensive hotels.

reviews.title: Airport Convenience
reviews.text: As soon as I checked in, I went up to my room, dropped all my stuff, and went exploring. I found out that there was a spa, so I decided to check it out. It was pretty decent, having a lap pool, a jacuzzi, a gym, massaging chairs, a sauna, and a bath area. The bath area was great because it had a japanese section and a western section, for those who were more comfortable showering the American way.

reviews.title: Great hotel for transit.
reviews.text: The only thing I didn't like was one of the restaurants, I think it was called Bamboo Garden. The food was great, but the prices were way up there. They offered single serving prices for people eating alone, and I made the mistake of actually ordering the single serving. All I can say is, when they decided on the serving size of the single serving they must have been thinking of a child.

description: Holiday Inn Tobu Narita is located just five minutes from Narita International Airport, the gateway to the skies connecting Japan with cities all over the world. It is a cosmopolitan resort hotel with many facilities for the travelers. Located on the first floor is a cheerful coffee shop and tea lounge. Banquet rooms, both large and small, have been created to answer the needs of our guests, from weddings to conferences. In addition, we are able to offer our guests the use of well designed athletic facilities, including an indoor swimming pool, a sauna, and a gymnasium. We make certain that the hospitality at Holiday Inn Tobu Narita is of the highest quality. Have a wonderful stay at our hotel, which promises you the best hotel service in Narita.
